summary: This document is a series of FBI emails from late June/early July 2020 discussing operational planning and travel approval for the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails reveal coordination between FBI units, tracking of Maxwell's phone to New Hampshire, and logistical details for the arrest operation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the FBI's arrest operation; her phone location is being tracked to New Hampshire.

events.title: FBI plans arrest operation for Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents request travel approval to arrest a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) believed to be in Massachusetts, planning to drive up the next day.

events.title: Phone tracking indicates Maxwell in New Hampshire
events.description: Historical phone data indicates the target's phone is in New Hampshire, causing the FBI to shift operational plans.

events.title: Discussion of technical asset deployment
events.description: FBI considers moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone, requiring approval for lodging expenses.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
Historical phone data placed Maxwell's phone in New Hampshire, contradicting earlier intelligence that she was in Massachusetts.
The operation involved multiple FBI agents and supervisors driving to the location, with plans to possibly escort the target back to New York.
The FBI considered deploying technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
Coordination occurred between the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit and the FBI New York field office.
